intro: Lacepedea, commonly known as the silky mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of trees and shrubs. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage that resembles lace. The plant lacks true roots and absorbs water and nutrients through its specialized haustoria that attach to the host plant. Its small, white or greenish flowers are often clustered and appear in the spring. Lacepedea is native to various regions in Australia and is often found in coastal and forested areas.
